title: Pre-market action: Here's the trade setup for today's session
summary: Indian markets saw choppy movement on Wednesday. Nifty closed lower by 41 points. Analysts suggest the underlying trend remains weak. Nifty is expected to find support around 25700-25650 levels. Any bounce back may face resistance around 25950-26000 levels. Foreign portfolio investors were net sellers.

title: Stocks in news: Ola Electric, Vedanta, Akzo Nobel, Jio Financial, NTPC
summary: Markets experienced volatility, closing with a marginal decline amid ongoing currency swings and mixed global signals. Analysts anticipate continued choppy price action, with key support at 25,700 and resistance around 25,950–26,050. Several companies, including Ola Electric, Vedanta, and NTPC, are in focus due to significant news developments.

title: More drops for AI stocks drag Wall Street to its worst day in nearly a month
summary: U.S. stock markets experienced a downturn for the fourth consecutive day, primarily driven by declines in AI stocks. The S&P 500 saw its worst day in nearly a month, with companies like Broadcom, Oracle, and Nvidia facing significant drops. Concerns about AI investment profitability and rising corporate debt weighed on investor sentiment.

title: Asian stocks decline as traders retreat from tech
summary: Asian markets opened lower mirroring losses in the US. Global investors adopted a risk-off approach. Technology stocks faced significant selling pressure. This sentiment impacted cryptocurrencies like Bitcoin. However, US futures showed a slight uptick. Concerns over AI company valuations and infrastructure spending are growing. This led to a rise in Treasury yields for longer maturities. Gold and silver prices surged.

title: Shriram Finance board to weigh stake sale to MUFG
summary: Shriram Finance's board will meet to consider selling an equity stake to Japan's MUFG, potentially for over ₹40,000 crore. This would be the largest strategic investment by an overseas lender in an Indian NBFC, following SMBC's investment in Yes Bank. The deal involves a primary issuance, with MUFG open to a higher stake later.

title: Insurers may soon get direct equity access to unlisted cos
summary: A proposed bill could allow Indian insurers, managing over ₹70 lakh crore, to invest directly in unlisted companies, removing a long-standing legal bar. This move would align them with other state-backed institutions and unlock new long-term capital for infrastructure and entrepreneurial ventures by enabling direct equity investments in private limited companies.

title: Can new acquisitions and capex drive Samvardhana stock to new highs?
summary: Samvardhana Motherson International's shares surged to a 52-week high, driven by anticipated revenue growth and margin expansion. The auto ancillary firm is investing heavily in new facilities and acquisitions, bolstering its order book and positioning for long-term industry consolidation and EV transition benefits.

title: Margin trading book at record high in Nov, but growth rate dips
summary: Investor borrowing via Margin Trading Funding reached a record high in November. However, the growth rate decelerated compared to previous months. This slowdown is linked to the weak performance of mid- and small-cap stocks. The overall equity market turnover on NSE also saw a decline. Analysts suggest this trend may continue until key market indices show sustained upward movement.

title: Sebi tweaks MF, IPO rules, skips conflict of interest changes
summary: The capital market regulator has approved significant changes to mutual fund fee structures, aiming for greater transparency and cost efficiency for investors. These reforms include reducing total expense ratios and brokerage fees, alongside simplifying IPO disclosures and revamping stock broker regulations. The board also deferred a decision on managing internal conflicts of interest.

title: India VIX hits new low as directionless market drains volatility
summary: India's Volatility Index (VIX) hit a fresh lifetime low of 9.84, reflecting expectations of reduced market swings. This decline is attributed to muted trading, a lack of significant market triggers, and reduced derivatives activity, with analysts noting a contraction in realized volatility and lower option premiums.

title: Stock Radar: SBI Life Insurance stock breaks out from downward sloping trendline; time to buy?
summary: SBI Life Insurance stock has achieved new record highs after breaking a downward trendline. Experts recommend buying the stock for short-term gains. title: Insurance companies must switch to 1600-series numbers by Feb 15: Trai
summary: All entities regulated by the Insurance Regulatory and Development Authority of India must use the designated numbering series for customer service and transaction-related calls, Trai said in a direction issued on Tuesday. The deadline was set in consultation with the insurance regulator.

title: CareEdge revises upward India's FY26 GDP growth forecast to 7.5%
summary: CareEdge Ratings has raised India's FY26 GDP growth forecast to 7.5% from 6.9%, citing stronger-than-expected first-half performance. Despite this upward revision, economic activity is expected to moderate in the latter half of the fiscal year. The rating firm also anticipates the rupee to trade between 89-90 against the dollar in FY27.

summary: Stocks to buy for long term: Vinit Bolinjkar of Ventura predicts a bullish trend for the Nifty 50, potentially reaching 29,000 by FY26-end. He highlights 10 value stocks to buy for the long term as he finds significant upside potential in them.&nbsp;

title: Small-cap stock surges 600% in nine months amid steady rise in net profit  — Do you own?
summary: In 2025, retail investors face losses in small-cap stocks, yet Cupid, a leading condom manufacturer, has thrived. Its shares surged 607% after a strong Q2, driven by significant profit growth and capacity expansion, positioning it as a top performer in India's stock market.

title: Nifty 50 rebounds after testing 50-DEMA support; is this a beginning of Santa Rally in Indian stock market?
summary: The Nifty has rebounded and is trading about 30 points higher, moving above the 25,800 mark. The Sensex is also in positive territory, climbing to around 84,600.

title: Phytochem Remedies IPO Day 1: Issue sees tepid demand, booked only 2% so far. Check price band, offer size, latest GMP
summary: Phytochem Remedies IPO Day 1: Phytochem Remedies IPO allotment will be finalised on December 23, while the listing date for its shares is December 26. Shares of the company are slated to debut on the BSE SME.

title: This retail company turned  ₹1 lakh in 2013 into  ₹3.3 crore today—and its growth story isn't over yet
summary: Mint assesses this company's growth potential and how it compares with its peers.

title: Jensen Huang's 22-year-old video captures Nvidia's success story: ‘I don't need to change the world overnight’
summary: Jensen Huang drew comparison to a game of pinball to describe a successful business, an analogy that has since become popular among his fans.&nbsp;

title: Japan's Mitsui plans investment in AM Green’s low-carbon aluminium push
summary: Japan’s Mitsui &amp; Co has signed an MoU with Greenko founders-backed AM Green to explore investments and offtake in renewable-powered aluminium, as global demand rises ahead of carbon border taxes.

title: Who is Rohit Prasad? Amazon CEO Andy Jassy announces departure of AI exec after 12-years
summary: For the past two years, Rohit Prasad led the creation of Amazon Nova and Amazon's artificial generative intelligence (AGI) unit organisation.&nbsp;

title: House of Diagnostics kicks off $30-40 million funding round amid gathering tailwinds
summary: The diagnostic services sector is expected to benefit from increased demand in the wellness and preventive testing segments, demographic changes, and a host of other factors.

title: Ola Electric shares have fallen 63% this year, hitting multiple 52-week lows. Is a sharper fall awaiting?
summary: Ola Electric shares remain under heavy pressure in 2025 after sustained promoter selling and weak technical signals. The stock has fallen sharply to fresh lows, with analysts flagging a strong downtrend, broken supports and limited upside potential, urging caution until key resistance levels are reclaimed.

title: FM Sitharaman presents Securities Markets Code Bill 2025. Here’s everything you need to know
summary: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman introduced the Securities Markets Code Bill, 2025 in the Lok Sabha, proposing a comprehensive overhaul of India’s securities laws. The Bill seeks to merge and replace the SEBI Act, Depositories Act and Securities Contracts Regulation Act into a single code to strengthen regulatory oversight, enhance investor protection, and improve ease of doing business.

title: MCX sets January 2 as record date for first-ever 1:5 stock split
summary: MCX has fixed January 2, 2026, as the record date for its first-ever 1:5 stock split. Eligible shareholders will receive five shares of Rs 2 each for every Rs 10 share held. The move aims to improve liquidity and broaden investor participation in MCX shares.  The company had earlier secured shareholder approval for the stock split in the month of September.

title: Volume Shocker: MFs add over 1 crore shares to these 6 stocks in November. Are you holding any?
summary: Mutual funds added over 1 crore shares to six stocks in November 2025, helping them rally up to 28%, even as four others slipped despite strong institutional buying.

title: Centre tables Securities Markets Code 2025; seeks repeal of three Acts to create a single framework
summary: The Bill seeks to simplify the Indian securities markets laws, replacing three decades-old Acts — the SEBI Act, 1992, the Depositories Act, 1996, and the Securities Contracts (Regulation) Act, 1956 — and proposing a single legislative framework.

title: Vishal Mega Mart’s steady climb leaves little room for missteps
summary: A year after listing, strong private labels, store expansion and operating leverage have powered Vishal Mega Mart’s rally—but at 59x forward earnings, execution risks loom larger.

title: PVR Inox to get Dhurandhar boost in Q3; content consistency is key
summary: The content line-up for Q4FY26 includes The Raja Saab, Border 2, Toxic and Dhurandhar Part 2. While some of these are big projects, consistency and quality of content are beyond PVR’s control.

title: Why is the Indian Rupee falling, but the stock market is stable after the delay in the India-US trade deal?
summary: USD vs INR: The Indian Rupee has declined 6% in 2025 due to Trump's tariffs and the delay in the India-US trade deal, while the Nifty 50 index remained in the 25,250 to 26,300 range
